div.p: AN ALARM To the Falſe SHEPHEARDS: Sounded forth before the Indignation of the Lord be poured out upon Them. This is the Word which I received from the Lord, the 24th. of the 12th. Month, 1659. in the night ſeaſon, as I lay upon my Bed, when deep ſleep was upon me, ſaying, Write my Controverſie with the falſe Paſtors, as I ſhall ſhew thee, who have ſcattered the Sheep of my Paſture, for I will gather them from their mouths, and they ſhall make a prey no longer of Them, ſaith the Lord. Here is alſo my TESTIMONY concerning the Word of God, in the behalf of my ſelf and Brethren, againſt both Teachers and People, who make a noiſe in the Nation, and tell People the Quakers deny the Word of God. Here alſo is declared, that the Word of God is our life, yea the ſame Word which the Scriptures of truth teſtifieth of, which Word abideth and endureth for ever.
From a lover of the Souls of all People, who am called, THOMAS GREENE.

p.hi: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my People as they eat bread, and call not upon the Lord; There were they in great fear, for God is in the generation of the righteous,

div.p: LONDON, Printed for Robert Wilſon, at the Sign of the Blackſpread Eagle and Wind-Mill in Martins, Le-grand, 1660.

div.head: AN ALARM TO THE Falſe Shepheards, Sounded forth before the Indignation of the Lord be poured out upon them.
div.p:
WO, Wo unto the Paſtors that deſtroy the ſheep of my Paſture, (ſaith the Lord) my controverſie is with you; and I will pour our my fury upon you, and you ſhall in no wiſe eſcape my Ier. 23. 1, 2 hand, becauſe you have ſcattered my flock, and driven them away, and have not viſited them; behold I will viſit upon you the evil of your doings, ſaith the Lord: yea this was the cry againſt the falſe Shepheards of Iſrael, and this is the cry of the Servant of the Lord againſt the falſe Shepheards of England; yea, woe be to the Shepheards that do feed Ezek 34. 2, 3, 4. themſelves, ſhould not the Shepheards feed the flocks? ye eat the fat, and ye cloath with the wooll, ye kill them that are fed, but yee feed not the flock; the diſeaſed have you not ſtrengtbened, neither have ye healed that which was ſick, neither have you bound up that which was broken, neither have ye brought again that which was driven away, neither have ye ſought that which was loſt, but with force and cruelty have ye ruled them; and
they were ſcattered becauſe there was no Shepheard, and they became meat to all the Beaſts of the field, when they were ſcattered: my ſheep wandred through all the Mountains, and upon every high hill, yea my flock was ſcattered upon all the face of the ver. 5, 6. earth; and none did ſearch nor ſeek after them: But have cauſed my people to erre, that bite with teeth, and cry peace, peace; and he that putteth not into their mouths they even prepare war againſt him, as did the falſe Prophets of old: therefore night ſhall come upon you that ye ſhall not have a viſion, and it ſhall be dark unto you, that ye ſhall not divine; and the Sun Mich. 3. 5, 6. ſhall go down over you, and the day ſhall be dark over you. Yea verily you are ſuch Prophets as they of old were, who built up Zion with blood, and Jeruſalem with iniquity; and telleth my people they muſt commit ſin ſo long as they live, and tell them Mich. 3. 10.
they ſhall not be freed from ſin on this ſide the grave, and ſo deny my Son Chriſt Jeſus, which is made manifeſt to deſtroy the works of the Devil, and to finiſh tranſgreſſion, and to make an end of ſin, and to preſent unto me a holy people without ſpot or wrinkle, or any ſuch thing; for I have given him to be a leader to my people, and to be my Salvation to the ends of the earth: ſaith the Lord. But as for you Oh Shepheards! you have run, and I have not ſent you, neither have you profited my people at all, neither have you cauſed them to turn from the evil of their wayes, but the hands of the wicked have been ſtrengthened by you, and have made ſpoile of my heritage, and have done as much as in you lyeth, to lay them as a vineyard without a hedge; and have bid the wicked go on and proſper, and have gloryed in the ſtrength of an Army, and have made fleſh your arme; and you bear rule by your means, and exerciſe tyranny over my people, yea the heads of you Judge for reward, and the Prieſts preach for hire, and the Prophets Divine for money; yet you lean upon the Lord, and ſay, is not the Lord amongſt us? no evil can come upon us; as the falſe Prophets did, Mich. 3. 11. yea, are you not ſuch Prophets as the Lord complained of by Ieremiah the true Prophet, who ſaid, A wonderful and a horrible thing is committed in the Land, the Prophets propheſie falſely, and the Prieſts bear rule by their means, and my people love to Ier. 5. 30. 31. have it ſo; but what will you do in the end thereof? And are
you not ſuch Shepheards that Iſaiah declared of, as their fruits made them manifeſt? Iſa. 56. 11. They are greedy, dumb dogs which can never have enough, and Shepheards that cannot underſtand, they all look to their own way, every one for his gain from his quarter. Now have not many of you been ſuch who have ſought your gain from your quarter, and if any who lived in your quarter, could not for conſcience ſake pay you, have not you cauſed many to be put in priſon, ſome until death? and have took trible damage of their goods that fears my name, who are obedient to what I command them; and ſo you bear rule by their means: So ye eat up my people as ye eat bread, and tread the reſidue under your feet, and ſo my heritage lyeth opreſſed, and none layeth it to heart; thus ſaith the Lord: Behold I am againſt the Shepheards, and I will require my flock at their hands, and cauſe them to ceaſe from feeding the flock, neither ſhall the Shepheards feed themſelves any more, for I will deliver Ier. 33. 10. 11. my flock from their mouth, that they may not be meat for them, for thus ſaith the Lord; Behold I even I, will both ſearch my ſheep and ſeek them out, as a Shepheard ſeeketh out his flock in the day that he is among his ſheep that are ſcattered; ſo will I ſeek out my ſheep, and will deliver them out of all places where they have been ſcattered in the Cloudy and dark day; and I will bring them out from the people, and gather them from the Countries, and will bring them into their own Land, and feed them upon the Mountains of Iſrael; yea I will feed my flock and I will cauſe them to lie down, ſaith the Lord, and I will ſet up a Shepheard which ſhall feed them, and they ſhall fear no more nor be diſmaid, neither ſhall they be lacking; but as for theſe Prophets who have cauſed my people to erre, behold I will feed them with worm-wood▪ and make them drink the water of gall; for from the Prophets is prophanneſs gone forth into all the Land, for I have not ſent theſe Prophets, yet they ran, I have not ſpoken to them, yet they Propheſied: therefore great is my controverſie Ier. 33. 21. with them, Ezek. 13. 22, 23. Becauſe with lies ye have made the heart of the righteous ſad, whom I have not made ſad, and ſtrengthened the hands of the wicked, that he ſhould not return from his wicked way, by promiſing him life. Therefore ye ſhall ſee no more vanity, nor divine divinations, for I will deliver my
people out of your hands, and ye ſhall know that I am the Lord; yea in the covenant which I promiſed to the Houſe of Iſrael will I gather my people, and I will put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts, and I will be their God, and they ſhall be my people: and they ſhall teach no more every man his Ier.
•• . 33, 34. neighbour, and every man his brother, ſaying, know the Lord; for they ſhall all know me from the leaſt of them to the greateſt of them, ſaith the Lord: And I will be unto them a father, and they ſhall be my Sons and Daughters, and they ſhall be all taught of me, & in my righteouſneſs will I eſtabliſh them; & great ſhall be their peace, Revel. 7. 15, 16, 17. And they ſhall ſerve me night and day in my Temple, and he that ſitteth on the Throne ſhall dwell among them, they ſhall hunger no more, neither thirſt any more, neither ſhall the Sun light on them, or any heat, for the Lamb which is in the midſt of the Throne ſhall feed them, and ſhall lead them unto living fountains of water, and ſhall wipe away all tears from their eyes. And I will bring my ſeed from all the Countries where they have been driven, and bring them to my holy hill of Zion, with joy & gladneſs upon their heads, & ſorrow and ſighing ſhall flee away; and they ſhall walk in the light of the Lamb, and there ſhall be no night there, and they need no candle, neither light of the Sun; for I the Lord giveth them light, and they ſhall raign for ever and ever: and the Nations of them that are ſaved ſhall walk in the light, and the Kings of the earth ſhall bring their glory and honour unto it, they ſhall dwell on high, their place of defence ſhall be in the munition of rocks; bread ſhall be given them, their waters ſhall be ſure, yea I will Iſa. 33 21. be unto them a place of broad rivers, and the ſtreams wherein no galley with oars, neither gallant ſhips paſs thereby. And my everlaſting Covenant ſhall be with them, and in them, even the ſure mercies of David, and they ſhall never more depart from me, for they are my portion and the lot of my inheritance, and I am their portion; they are my ſheep and I am their Shepheard, and the Sheep of my Paſture are men.

And all my dear friends whom the Lord God hath called in this day of his mighty power, from amongſt the falſe Shepheards and hirelings, who have had your money for that which have not been bread, and you have laboured for that which ſatisfied
not: Rejoyce in the Lord for evermore, and be exceeding glad; praiſe him for ever, who hath choſen you above all the Families of the earth, to place his Name in you▪ even the Name that is above every Name: Oh Friends, let his loving kindneſs never be forgotten, who hath made a way in the Wilderneſs, and a path in the deſart, and hath raiſed his own ſeed up in you, unto which partaineth the promiſe of life and peace: Oh dear Friends, who have taſted of the Word of God, and of the power which hath no end; praiſe ye the Lord, durable praiſes and endleſs dominion be given unto him, of all my dear Friends; Haljlujah be unto him for evermore, who is come to raign, whoſe right it is, God bleſſed for ever; unto him be everlaſting praiſes for evermore.

div.head: This is my Teſtimony concerning the VVord of God.
div.p:
VVHereas there is a great Cry in this Nation of England, with Prieſts and People, ſaying, the Quakers deny the Word of God; here I ſhall declare on the contrary, that the ſame Word which the Scriptures of truth declareth of, we own, for it is our Life; yea the ſame Word which was glorified with the Father before the World began, by which the world was made, as John 1. 1, 2, 3. ſaith he, In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God the ſame was in the beginning with God; All things were made by him, and without him was not any thing made that was made; in him was life, and the life was the light of men; Mark, in the Word was life, and this Word we own according to Scriptures, and it is our life, yea Chriſt Jeſus the Word of God, as Revel. 19. 13. and who was cloathed with a veſture dipt in blood, his name is called the Word of God; and this word we own, which Word was in the beginning of the Creation of God, which was,
which is▪ and is to come; This is he who was the firſt and the laſt, which was dead and is alive, and liveth for evermore: and this Word is true from the beginning, as ſaith David, Pſal. 119. 160. Thy Word is true from the beginning, and every one of thy righteouus Judgments endureth for ever: and David ſaid, Thy Word is a Lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my paths: and by this Word was Davids ſteps ordered, which Word he hid in his heart, and in this Word he meditated; and ſaith David in a certain place, I rejoyce at thy Word, as one that findeth great ſpoil; and this is the Word which we bear Teſtimony unto, in which is life, and he that hath this word hath life, and he that hath not this word hath not life; ſo he that hath this word may ſpeak it, as Jer. 23. 28 29. He that hath my word let him ſpeak my word faithfully; What is the Chaff to the Wheat, ſaith the Lord? for ſaith the Lord, Is not my Word like a fire, and like an hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces? and we know the Word in us as the Scripture declareth, that cutteth down and burneth up that which is contrary to God in us; and we know him who ſits as a Reſiners fire, to burn up all that is contrary unto him; for who amongſt the ſons of men can dwell with the devouring fire? or who can dwell with everlaſting burnings? Now this is he that can dwell with everlaſting burnings, he that walketh righteouſly, and ſpeaketh uprightly; he that deſpiſeth the gain of oppreſſion, that ſhaketh his hands from holding of Bribes, that ſtoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and ſhutteth his eyes from ſeeing of evil; he only can dwell with the Word of God▪ and this is the Word of God which Judgeth the wicked man for his wickedneſs; and this is he which was in the beginning with the Father, before the Heavens were framed, or the foundations of the Earth were laid; and this Word we bear teſtimony unto, which became fleſh and dwell amongſt the Apoſtles, as the Scripture of truth declareth; and by the ſame Word is the World kept to this day, ſtanding in the water and out of the water, and all things are upheld by him, Heb. 1. 3. Who being the brightneſs of his glory, and the expreſs image of his perſon, and upholding all things by the Word of his power; and this Word we bear teſtimony is nigh people, as the Scripture of truth declareth; in the heart, and in the mouth.
But it may be ſaid, did not the Apoſtles preach Chriſt in the Scriptures? or did they not bid people look for him?

Anſw. Nay, the Apoſtles preached Chriſt the word, nigh in the heart and in the mouth, and ſaid, there is no need to ſay, who ſhall deſcend, or who ſhall aſcend, or go beyond the Seas, but what ſaith it? the word is nigh in the heart and in the mouth, that you may hear it and do it; and this is the more ſure word of Propheſie, which you will do well if you take heed unto, as unto a light that ſhineth in a dark place; and there was them who had the word of God abiding in them, to whom John writ, 1 John 2. 14. I have written unto you young men, becauſe you are ſtrong and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one; and this word is to be known within the anointed of God, as, 1 John 2. 27. But the anointing which ye have received of him, abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you, but as the ſame anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie; and even as it hath taught you, ye ſhall abide in him. And the word of God which Paul was a Miniſter of, we bear teſtimony unto, which word he did not preach till he was revealed in him, as Gal. 1. 15, 16. ſaith he, When it pleaſed God who ſeperated me from my mothers womb, and called me by his grace, to reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen: So now people may plainly ſee, that Paul did not preach Chriſt, who is the word, till he was revealed in him, and this was the end of his Miniſtry, and of his travail, who ſaid, I travail in birth again till Chriſt be formed in you; he did not ſay he travelled till they profeſſed Chriſt or Scriptures, or talking of him, but till he was formed in them, for he was in them, as ſaith Paul, 2 Cor. 13. 5. Examine your ſelves, whether you be in the faith, prove your own ſelves, know you not your own ſelves, how that Jeſus Chriſt is in you except ye be reprobates: and when he writ to the Coloſſians, Col. 3 16. ſaid, Let the word dwell in you richly in all wiſdome; and this word we bear teſtimony unto, which we know St. Paul declareth, Heb. 4. 12. The word of God is quick and powerful, and ſharper than any two edged ſword, piercing even to the dividing aſunder of ſoul and Spirit, and of the joynts, and marrow; and is a diſcerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart: ſo this is the word of God which divides between
the pretious and the vile in people, that which cuts down the unruly nature, that is the word of God, yea the ſword of the ſpirit is the word of God, and ſo that which cuts down the wicked one in people, the ſame reconcileth to God, and this word was committed unto the Apoſtles, for ſaith Paul, 2 Cor. 5. 19. He hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation; ſo the ſame word which cutteth down the man of ſin in people, the ſame reconciles to God, as the Scriptures of truth declareth.
Yea, but it may be ſaid, Chriſt ſaid, ſearch the Scriptures, then cannot we find Chriſt if we ſearch them?

Anſw. The Jews ſearched the Scriptures, and thought in them to have eternal life, for they are they which teſtifie of me, (ſaith Chriſt) but you will not come to me, that you may have life: ſo friend whoſoever thou art, I do not deny but thou maiſt ſearch the Scriptures which teſtifieth of Chriſt, but thou can never have life till thou come to that which Scripture teſtifieth of, which is Chriſt Jeſus the word of God.
Yea, but it may be ſaid, we had thought the Scriptures had been the Word.

Anſw. Nay Friend, by the Word the World was made, which was before Scriptures was, which Word abideth and endureth for ever; the Scriptures did not make the World, but the Word which the Scripture teſtifieth of, which he that hath it hath life, he that hath not the Word, hath not life; ſo it is the ingrafted Word which is able to ſave the ſoul.
Then ſome may object and ſay, if thou ſayes Chriſt is the Word, and the Word is but one, then thou denies Scriptures.

Anſw. Nay, the Scriptures of truth I own, which was ſpoken forth as the holy Men of God was moved of the holy Ghoſt, which are good in their places; yea, let my Pen fall out of my hand, and my arm from my ſhoulder, and my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, rather then I ſhould deny the Scriptures of truth, for they I truly own, which teſtifieth of the Word; but the Scriptures are Words, as Exod.
• 0. 1. And God ſpake all theſe Words, ſaying; &c. for the Scriptures were called Words before Chriſt Jeſus the Word of God was made manifeſt in the fleſh; and this Word came unto the Prophets, which
came out from the Father, as you may read in Iſaiah, Jeremiah, Ezekiel, and other of the Prophets, who ſaid, The Word of the Lord came unto them, ſaying; they did not ſay, the Scriptures came unto them, ſaying, but the Word, from which they ſpake forth Scriptures; and ſo the Scriptures declareth and teſtifieth of the Word, from which Word the Scriptures were ſpoken forth by the Prophets, Chriſt, and the Apoſtles; and they were given forth to be believed in, and to be fulfilled; and ſo the Scriptures of truth we own, which was ſpoken forth from the Spirit of God, as the holy men of God was moved of the holy Ghoſt: and this is writ to ſtop the mouths of them, who ſay we deny the Word, and for the information of the ſimple hearted, who deſire to know what we believe, as conconcerning that thing; I have by plain Scriptures, laid down that we own no other Word, but that by which the World was made, and by which the Scriptures were ſpoken forth; which Word abideth and endureth for ever.

dateline.date: the 5th. day of the firſt Month, near 1660.

closer.signed: From one who waits to ſee the Redemption of Mankind from under the bondage of Corruption; who is called, Thomas Greene.
